channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: AIと著作権で保護されたコンテンツをめぐる米国著作権局の可能な変更に対する、メタ、グーグル、マイクロソフト、アップルを含むAI企業の対応を見てみよう（Wes Davis/The Verge）
item.description:
Wes Davis / The Verge:
A look at AI companies' responses, including from Meta, Google, Microsoft, and Apple, to possible US Copyright Office changes around AI and copyrighted content  —  The biggest companies in AI aren't interested in paying to use copyrighted material as training data, and here are their reasons why.

item.title: CNN、ラジオ番組でウルフ・ブリッツァーとジェイク・タッパーを「自己嫌悪するユダヤ人」と表現したフォックス・ニュースの司会者マーク・レビンを批判（イスラエル・ハマス戦争報道を引き合いに）（Jeremy Barr/Washington Post紙
item.description:
Jeremy Barr / Washington Post:
CNN criticizes Fox News host Mark Levin for describing Wolf Blitzer and Jake Tapper as “self-hating Jews” on his radio show citing Israel-Hamas war coverage  —  On his radio show, Levin also alleged that CNN journalists asking questions about the death toll in Gaza are ‘giving aid and comfort to the enemy’

item.title: ワシントン・ポスト紙の次期CEO、ウィル・ルイスのプロフィール。英国生まれの元記者で、テレグラフ紙のEICを務め、Z世代をターゲットにした「ザ・ニュース・ムーブメント」を共同設立した。
item.description:
New York Times:
A profile of The Washington Post's next CEO, Will Lewis, a UK-born former reporter and Telegraph EIC who co-founded The News Movement aimed at Gen Z audiences  —  The former Dow Jones executive most recently co-founded The News Movement, a start-up aimed at young audiences.

item.title: ワシントン・ポスト紙、2024年1月2日付で元ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル発行人兼ダウ・ジョーンズCEOのウィリアム・ルイス氏を新発行人兼CEOに指名（ワシントン・ポスト紙）
item.description:
Washington Post:
The Washington Post names former Wall Street Journal publisher and Dow Jones CEO William Lewis as its new publisher and CEO, effective January 2, 2024  —  The Washington Post announces William Lewis as its new Publisher and CEO.  Lewis will assume the role effective Jan. 2, 2024 …

item.title: SAG-AFTRA、AMPTPが "最後、最善、最終 "と呼ぶ提案を検討中と発表。
item.description:
Deadline:
SAG-AFTRA says it's reviewing a proposal the AMPTP called its “last, best, and final offer”; source: it includes “full” AI protections and a compensation hike  —  UPDATE, 3:14PM AFTER EXCLUSIVE: After meeting with studio CEOs earlier today, SAG-AFTRA has put out a statement …

item.title: ジョージ・フロイドの抗議デモで地面に投げつけられ逮捕されたLAist特派員のジョシー・ホアンが、LA郡と70万ドルの和解金を手にした（Frank Stoltze/LAist）
item.description:
Frank Stoltze / LAist:
LAist correspondent Josie Huang reaches a $700,000 settlement with LA County after she was thrown to the ground and arrested during the George Floyd protests  —  Support your source for local news!  —  In these challenging times, the need for reliable local reporting has never been greater.

item.title: ジョナサン・メジャーの法的問題、番組や映画を通じた過剰なコンテンツ供給、VFXスタッフの過労など、マーベルの危機について（Tatiana Siegel/Variety）
item.description:
Tatiana Siegel / Variety:
A look at the crisis at Marvel, including Jonathan Majors' legal issues, its machine pumping out too much content via shows and movies, and overworked VFX staff  —  This past September, a group of Marvel creatives, including studio chief Kevin Feige, assembled in Palm Springs for the studio's annual retreat.

item.title: 10月28日に大英図書館を襲った「サイバー事件」の後、同図書館のウェブサイトはオフラインのままであり、学者はオンライン目録にアクセスできない（Alex Marshall/New York Times）。
item.description:
Alex Marshall / New York Times:
After a “cyber incident” hit the British Library on October 28, the library's website remains offline and scholars are unable to access its online catalog  —  Libraries across Europe appear to be facing attacks from cybercriminals.  At Britain's national library, an “incident” is sending scholars back to an analog age.

item.title: 情報筋：AMPTPは11月3日、SAG-AFTRAに新たな契約案を提示、グループ間の協議は週末まで続く（Ross A. Lincoln/The Wrap）
item.description:
Ross A. Lincoln / The Wrap:
Sources: the AMPTP presented SAG-AFTRA with a new contract offer on November 3, and talks between the groups will continue through the weekend  —  The two sides are inching toward a deal that could bring the Hollywood strike to an end  —  The strike isn't over yet, but on Friday night …

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズ』誌のスタッフライター、ジャズミン・ヒューズが辞職。編集者のジェイク・シルヴァースタインは、イスラエルのガザ包囲に抗議する書簡に署名したことがポリシーに違反したと述べている（ケイティ・ロバートソン／ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
Katie Robertson / New York Times:
New York Times Magazine staff writer Jazmine Hughes resigns; editor Jake Silverstein said she violated policy by signing a letter protesting Israel's Gaza siege  —  The writer, Jazmine Hughes, who has won awards for her work, had signed another letter of protest this year.

item.title: ソースStarzは、2024年第1四半期のライオンズゲートからの分離に先立ち、英国およびオーストラリアからの撤退を計画しており、～670人の従業員の10％以上、ただし100人未満をレイオフする予定（Dade Hayes/Deadline）
item.description:
Dade Hayes / Deadline:
Source: Starz plans to exit the UK and Australia ahead of its separation from Lionsgate in Q1 2024 and lay off 10%+ of its ~670 employees, but fewer than 100  —  - World Series Ratings Low Is No Reason For “Grand Statements” About Major League Baseball's Decline, Fox Exec Michael Mulvihill Says; 2024 Outlook Is “Unchanged”

item.title: コムスコア：The Vergeのトラフィックは、2022年9月のデザイン変更後、1ヶ月を除いて毎月前年同月比で減少。
item.description:
Mark Stenberg / Adweek:
Comscore: The Verge's YoY traffic fell every month but one after September 2022's redesign; The Verge: loyal user base is up 62% from January to September 2023  —  The publisher, like much of the industry, has seen traffic steadily decline  —  When The Verge launched its redesigned website last September …

item.title: YouTubeが広告ブロッカーの取り締まりを拡大した10月、広告ブロッカーは記録的なアンインストールを記録したが、取り締まりの影響を受けなかった広告ブロッカーは記録的なインストールを記録した（Paresh Dave/Wired）
item.description:
Paresh Dave / Wired:
Ad blockers saw record uninstalls in October after YouTube expanded its crackdown on ad blockers, while those unaffected by the clampdown saw record installs  —  YouTube expanded a “test” that threatens to cut off users who don't turn off their ad blocker.  Developers of the tools are scrambling to respond.

item.title: 情報源リカレント・ベンチャーズ、アレックス・バルガスCEOを1年で解任し、共同創業者で元ノース・エクイティのマネージング・ディレクター、アンドリュー・パールマンをCEOに昇格（Mark Stenberg/Adweek）
item.description:
Mark Stenberg / Adweek:
Sources: Recurrent Ventures dismisses CEO Alex Vargas after one year and elevates its co-founder and former North Equity Managing Director Andrew Perlman to CEO  —  Co-founder Andrew Perlman, a private equity executive, replaces Alex Vargas in the role  —  The media company Recurrent Ventures …

item.title: ワイアードは今後数週間で、米国と世界の選挙と政治にテクノロジーが与える影響について、4人の専任ライターと編集者による垂直立ち上げを計画している（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Wired plans to launch a vertical on the impact of tech on US and global elections and politics in the coming weeks, run by four full-time writers and an editor  —  Wired, the technology publication owned by Condé Nast, is launching a new vertical that will focus on the intersection …
